title: Rodgers plans to sign with Steelers, sources say
description: Aaron Rodgers plans to sign with the Steelers, sources told ESPN, uniting the future Hall of Famer with a team that desperately needs a QB.
author: Brooke Pryor

title: Fever star Clark (quad) could return next week
description: Indiana Fever star Caitlin Clark, who has missed the past three games with a left quad strain, will be reevaluated this weekend and could return as early as next week.
author: Alexa Philippou

title: 'Genius' Yamal & all-time classic - why Spain are World Cup favourites
description: Spain and France play out a Nations League semi-final game for the ages with a scoreline that looks more like a penalty shootout.

title: 'There is no crisis' before Euro 2025 - Wiegman
description: England manager Sarina Wiegman says "there is no crisis" despite a chaotic 10 days in the build-up to Euro 2025.

title: Steelers QBs: Where Russell Wilson, Justin Fields, Kenny Pickett are now
description: There's been plenty of turnover at the most important position on the roster for the Steelers. Here's where their former starters are in 2025.

title: Michael Conforto's tiebreaking RBI single is a ray of hope in his gloomy season with the Dodgers
description: Michael Conforto smacked a sharp drive to left with two outs in the eighth inning Thursday, and he celebrated at first base while Andy Pages scored the tiebreaking run for the Los Angeles Dodgers. The big hit ended up deciding the Dodgers' 6-5 victory over the New York Mets. “It’s been a grind up to this point, and all I want to do is go up there and help us win,” Conforto said.
author: GREG BEACHAM

title: How 'destructive' Delap can bring the best out of Palmer and Chelsea
description: "I was sick of getting the ball and going backwards or sideways," said Cole Palmer about Chelsea's Conference League final contest with Real Betis. And then he took the game by the scruff of the neck.

title: Wiegman dismisses 'noise' and insists England are not in crisis
description: Sarina Wiegman has insisted England are not in crisis after some high-profile squad withdrawals - and believes her final Euro 2025 squad has enough experience and balance to retain the trophy.
